file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 21-22-04-04 - GROUND CONNECTION VALVE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL GROUND CONNECTION VALVE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-135 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove, install, deactivate, and reactivate the ground connection valve. B. This valve is a flap-type check valve and it interfaces with a rubber seal ring attached to the surface of the ground connection frame. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ACFT MODEL(S) GROUND CONNECTION VALVE - RE- 21-22-04-000-801-A EMB-135 MOVAL ACFT MODEL(S) GROUND CONNECTION VALVE - INSTAL- 21-22-04-400-801-A EMB-135 LATION ACFT MODEL(S) GROUND CONNECTION DOOR RUBBER 21-22-04-000-802-A EMB-135 SEAL RING - REMOVAL ACFT MODEL(S) GROUND CONNECTION DOOR RUBBER 21-22-04-400-802-A EMB-135 SEAL RING - INSTALLATION ACFT MODEL(S) GROUND CONNECTION VALVE - DEAC- 21-22-04-040-801-A EMB-135 TIVATION PROCEDURES ACFT MODEL(S) GROUND CONNECTION VALVE - REAC- 21-22-04-440-801-A EMB-135 TIVATION PROCEDURES EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General CONFIG-2 21-22-04 Page 1 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 21-22-04-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-135 2. GROUND CONNECTION VALVE - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the instructions to remove the ground connection valve. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 - AMM TASK 25-21-01-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 53-01-02-000-802-A/400 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 191 191AR Wing-to-fuselage fairing 242 242DF (as applicable) Passenger cabin floor 242 242BF (as applicable) Passenger cabin floor D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task On the wing-to-fuselage fairing I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-019-B (1) Remove the passenger seat (AMM TASK 25-21-01-000-801-A/400) installed on floor panel 242BF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100). (2) Remove passenger-cabin floor panel 242BF (AMM TASK 53-01-02-000-802-A/400 and AMM MPP 06-41-02/100). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 21-22-04 Page 2 of 13 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) Remove the adhesive tape. Then loosen and move away from its position the main distribution-manifold air-duct, installed after the mixture chamber. (4) Open access panel 191AR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-019-B (1) Remove the safety wire (1). (2) Remove the two screws (2). (3) Remove the ground connection valve (3) (flap-type). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 21-22-04 Page 3 of 13 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 21-22-04-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-135 3. GROUND CONNECTION VALVE - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the instructions to install the ground connection valve. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM MPP 06-41-02/100 - AMM TASK 25-21-01-400-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600 - AMM TASK 53-01-02-400-802-A/400 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 191 191AR Wing-to-fuselage fairing 242 242DF (as applicable) Passenger cabin floor 242 242BF (as applicable) Passenger cabin floor D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task On the wing-to-fuselage fairing I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-019-B (1) Install the ground connection valve (3) (flap-type). (2) Install the two screws (2). (3) Install the safety wire (1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 21-22-04 Page 5 of 13 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-019-B (1) Install the main distribution-manifold air-duct in position and attach it with adhesive tape. (2) Do an inspection on the fuel quantity indication harness (AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600). NOTE: The inspection of fuel quantity indication harness is a part of Critical Design Configuration Control Limitations (CDCCL) in the Airworthiness Limitations (Section 6) of the Maintenance Review Board Report (MRB). (3) Install passenger-cabin floor panel 242BF (AMM TASK 53-01-02-400-802-A/400 and AMM MPP 06-41-02/100). (4) Install the passenger seat (AMM TASK 25-21-01-400-801-A/400) on floor panel 242BF (AMM MPP 06-41-02/100). (5) Close access panel 191AR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 21-22-04 Page 6 of 13 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 21-22-04-000-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-135 4. GROUND CONNECTION DOOR RUBBER SEAL RING - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the instructions to remove the rubber seal ring of the ground connection door frame. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AIRCRAFT SAFE PROCEDURES FOR MAINTE- AMM TASK 20-00-00-910-801-A/200 NANCE SERVICES - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 191 191AR Forward wing-to-fuselage fairing D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Polyethylene spatula To remove the rubber seal ring available E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task On the forward wing-to-fuselage fairing I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-018-C WARNING: MAKE SURE THAT THE AIRCRAFT IS IN A SAFE CONDITION BEFORE YOU DO THE MAINTENANCE PROCEDURES. THIS IS TO PREVENT INJURY TO PERSONS AND/OR DAMAGE TO THE EQUIPMENT. (1) Do the procedure to make the aircraft safe for maintenance ( AMM TASK 20-00-00-910-801-A/200). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 CONFIG-2 21-22-04 Page 7 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) Open the access door 191AR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). J. Removal (Figure 402) SUBTASK 020-018-C (1) Open the ground connection flap-type check valve (2). (2) Remove the rubber seal ring (1) from the surface with the aid of a polyethylene spatula, as applicable. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-802-A/400 CONFIG-2 21-22-04 Page 8 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 21-22-04-400-802-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-135 5. GROUND CONNECTION DOOR RUBBER SEAL RING - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the instructions to install the rubber seal ring of the ground connection door frame. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AIRCRAFT SAFE PROCEDURES FOR MAINTE- AMM TASK 20-00-00-910-801-A/200 NANCE SERVICES - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES AMM TASK 21-31-00-700-808-A/500 - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 191 191AR Forward wing-to-fuselage fairing D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Wiper cloth To clean the surface available Commercially Sandpaper No. 180 To sand the surface available E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) TT-M-261 Methyl Ehtyl Ketone (MEK) AR MMM-A-121 Adhesive EC1300L AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task On the forward wing-to-fuselage fairing EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 CONFIG-2 21-22-04 Page 10 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Installation (Figure 402) SUBTASK 420-018-C WARNING: • PUT ON SAFETY GOGGLES, PROTECTIVE MASK AND RUBBER GLOVES WHEN SANDING SURFACES. • DO NOT BREATHE THE DUST RELEASED DURING THE PROCESS BECAUSE THIS IS DANGEROUS TO THE RESPIRATORY TRACT. (1) Lightly sand the surface with a sandpaper. WARNING: • PUT ON SAFETY GOGGLES, PROTECTIVE MASK AND RUBBER GLOVES WHEN APPLYING SOLVENT DURING THE CLEANING PROCESS. • DO NOT BREATHE THE SOLVENT VAPORS AND PREVENT THE CONTACT OF THE SOLVENT WITH THE SKIN AND/OR EYES BECAUSE THIS IS DANGEROUS TO THE RESPIRATORY TRACT AND CAN CAUSE SKIN IRRITATION. • IF ANY CHEMICAL PRODUCT BE IN CONTACT WITH SKIN AND/OR EYES, FLUSH IT (THEM) WITH WATER IMMEDIATELY AND GET MEDICAL AID. (2) Wipe the surface with a clean cloth soaked with MEK (TT-M-261). NOTE: Before solvent evaporation, wipe the surface with a dry and clean cloth. (3) Apply adhesive EC1300L (MMM-A- 121) to the rubber seal ring (1) and to the surface where it will be installed. (4) Install the rubber seal ring (1) on the surface. (5) Wait the adhesive to cure. Refer to the manufacturer instructions. (6) Close the ground connection flap-type check valve (1). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-018-C (1) Do the functional test for Cabin Leakage with Air Bled from the Engine or APU (AMM TASK 21-31-00-700-808-A/500). (2) Close the access door 191AR (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (3) Put the aircraft on its initial configuration ( AMM TASK 20-00-00-910-801-A/200). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-802-A/400 CONFIG-2 21-22-04 Page 11 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 21-22-04-040-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-135 6. GROUND CONNECTION VALVE - DEACTIVATION PROCEDURES A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to deactivate the Ground Connection Valve. (2) This task refers to item 21-22-04 - Ground Connection Valve - of DDPM. (3) The airplane may be dispatched with the external ground connector check valve inoperative: • Closed. • Open, provided the flight is conducted in an unpressurized configuration B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION ELECTROPNEUMATIC OUTFLOW VALVE - DEACTI- AMM TASK 21-31-03-040-801-A/400 VATION PROCEDURE PNEUMATIC OUTFLOW VALVE - DEACTIVATION AMM TASK 21-31-04-040-801-A/400 PROCEDURE C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended Not Applicable I. Deactivation Procedures SUBTASK 040-004-C (1) Refer to Electropneumatic and Pneumatic Outflow Valves Deactivation Procedures (AMM TASK 21-31-03-040-801-A/400 and AMM TASK 21-31-04-040-801-A/400 ) for outflow valves secured open, if required. (2) Write in the aircraft technical logbook that you did the deactivation procedure for the Ground Connection Valve. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 040-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 21-22-04 Page 12 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 21-22-04-440-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-135 7. GROUND CONNECTION VALVE - REACTIVATION PROCEDURES A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to reactivate the Ground Connection Valve. (2) This task refers to item 21-22-04 - Ground Connection Valve - of DDPM. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION ELECTROPNEUMATIC OUTFLOW VALVE - REACTI- AMM TASK 21-31-03-440-801-A/400 VATION PROCEDURE PNEUMATIC OUTFLOW VALVE - REACTIVATION AMM TASK 21-31-04-440-801-A/400 PROCEDURE C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended Not Applicable I. Reactivation Procedures SUBTASK 440-004-C (1) Do the troubleshooting and the applicable corrective maintenance procedure for the Ground Connection Valve. (2) Refer to Electropneumatic and Pneumatic Outflow Valves Reactivation Procedures (AMM TASK 21-31-03-440-801-A/400 and AMM TASK 21-31-04-440-801-A/400 ), if required. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 440-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 21-22-04 Page 13 of 13 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
